column20: I have been teaching swimming lessons for about a year and a half  and I absolutely love it. It has been so much fun and I love the sweet kids I get to work with. I started swimming when I was 3  taking lessons for KOPFC and have been a swimmer ever since. I am very good at teaching all strokes  but my I am best at teaching freestyle  backstroke  and breaststroke. I love helping my students reach their full potential. I teach all ages  anywhere from 3 to adults.

I have been swimming since I was very little  I started taking swim lessons at Kearns when I was about 3 or 4. I love kids and really enjoy teaching them. I am very energetic and creative. One of the hardest strokes to learn is breaststroke and that is my best stroke and I can teach it very well.
This is my first year teaching. I swam competitively for 12 years I swam backstroke and freestyle.
I swam for 3 years on KYAT and 3 years in high school.  I have been teaching for 5 years.  I was a breaststroker in high school  so that is my favorite to teach.
I have been swimming for 7 years and I love it. I am very excited to help teach swimming lessons this summer.
I have been a swim instructor for about two years. I have also been a coach for the youth swim team  KYAT  as well as multiple elementary water polo teams.

I have been teaching swim lessons for three years and have loved every second of it. I work well with all age groups. I have had quite a bit of experience teaching young kids  kids getting ready for swim team  siblings looking for a new activity  and even adults.

I have been swimming since the age of 6 and have loved it ever since. I swam for KYAT and for Copper Hills during high school. I have been teaching lessons at KOPFC for the past 5 years. I am coaching KYAT and our swim adventure group. I love seeing the progress in our young swimmers and developing their technique in all strokes.

Ive been teaching swim lessons since Spring 2015. Ive been swimming since I was 15 (both club and high school)  and have played water polo since my sophomore year in high school (three years). Swimming is my passion  and I love being able to share that with the kids who come through this program. I currently coach the club swim team at Snow College  so I enjoy helping the older age groups and helping teach the more difficult strokes like butterfly and breaststroke. That being said  I still love teaching all the age groups as well.

I started taking swimming lessons here at Kearns when I was 3 years old and loved it.  I swam for the youth team for 2 years and for High School for 4 years. I absolutely loved it. I have been teaching for about 4 years and I love doing it.

I have been teaching swim lessons for three 3 years. For about 10 years I swam competitively on Kearns Youth Aquatic Team (KYAT) and Two years in High School. I like to help students refine their stokes. I can be frustrating for a student who is struggling for an extend period of time. By breaking the stokes down into steps and build it back up. By working with drills and a single part of the stoke it helps the student to but all the parts of the stoke back together and swim the stoke better. I also like to help student learn the basics such as floating (relaxing)  blowing bubbles  etc. Once a student has mastered these skills it will make learning freestyle and the other stokes much easier. I am really good with children of all ages and am very patient. When I need to I push the students to do their best so they can succeed

I have been working at the Kearns Oquirrh Park Fitness Center for 3 years. Three years as a life guard and one as on instructor. I love kids I get along with kids of all ages  but particularly with younger ones. We work hard  but makes sure to have fun while doing so.
Have been swimming for 8 years and playing water polo for 6. This will be my second year teaching

Im a new hire this year. I have been swimming sense the age of 5. I can help you or your child with back stroke or free-style. I can do the other strokes too  but those are my better strokes. I love kids and seeing their knowledge grow in the water and their face light up when they get new things.

I tought last summer and now Im teaching this summer. I started out learning in the water with diving lessons on the springboards that used to be in the comp pool at Kearns   and went from there  now I swim  dive and play water Polo at Kearns. Ive been participating in aquatic programs here since I was 10. Now that Im teaching Im happy to help students learn in any water sport I can help with. My favorite steps are all of them   I swim IM  and the 100 fly competitively  so I know the strobes and diving the best   so those are what I cam help with best.

Hello  my name is Kennedy I have been teaching for just over a year and have been swimming and playing water polo for four years. I work well with young children and working on learning freestyle or backstroke or just touch up things to help students move on to their next level.
Ive loved swimming my entire life and swam competitively all throughout high school. My absolute favorite stroke is butterfly so Im super excited to get kids to love my favorite stroke.
I am a new swim instructor just this summer. I was on my high school swim team for 3 years and competed in freestyle  backstroke  and breaststroke.
Im on my high school swim team  and this is my second year teaching swim lessons. I absolutely love working with kids  and I can usually make the process of learning to swim fun.
I have coached competitive age group swimming. I like to work with kids trying to get on to the swim team.

Hello  my name is Megan. I am the mom to 3 active boys who love the water. We are a swimming family and teaching kids to be safe in the water is important. Teaching kids to be able to tread water and float is the first step to help them not to panic in the water if you are out of reach. I have been swimming for a long time  and just recently decided to start teaching. I would love help teach your child to love the water and swim.

This is my first time teaching lessons but I am super excited. I started swimming ever since I was three years old. After I completed my lessons I swam  kyat. Soon after I tried water polo and have been playing ever since; over seven years. I have been on the Kearns High swim team for two years and will be joining again this coming school year. I learn by watching other people do things. Once I see them complete a task I can teach the same thing. Since I have been swimming and watching other people swim so long I am comfortable teaching any stroke or skill in the water.

Ive been teaching for a year now. I love my job. It is so much fun to spend time with my kids and get to know them during the set. My favorite classes are the older ones  mainly whale  shark and also crab. :)
I have been swimming competitively for 13 years  and I specialize in teaching butterfly. I love working with kids of all ages  and getting them to love swimming.

I have been teaching for about 5 years at KOPFC. I love to teach all ages  and all levels of learning. I feel comfortable teaching different ways to accomplish the same goal (ex. learning backstroke  freestyle  etc).

This is my first year teaching swim lessons  and this is my third year at the pool as a lifeguard. I have been around kids for many years and I enjoy teaching them. My favorite thing about teaching is helping someone do something they couldnt do before. I love to swim and be in the pool.
This is my first year teaching. I have been swimming for 10 and a half years. I love teaching freestyle and backstroke.

I have been working as a lifeguard 6 years and teaching now for 23 years  also coached Jr. and Sr. Bronze KYAT swim team last 1 1/2 years. Love working with people helping them to be better swimmers. Look forward to working with you.
I have been teaching for three years. I enjoy working on stroke technique for all strokes I also enjoy teaching all ages.

This is my first year being a swim instructor. Ive been swimming competitively and playing water polo for 9 years. I have always loved the water. I love being able to help kids come out of their shell  and learn to love the water as much as I do.
Ive been swimming for 6 years. Im going to be playing water polo in college. I feel though Im good with younger children. I enjoy teaching freestyle and backstroke.
I have been teaching for about 3 1/2 years and I love it. I swim in high school for four years  and before that I am on a pre-competition swim team. My favorite strokes are butterfly and backstroke.

I have been teaching since the summer of 2015. I have loved every bit of it. I swam in high school and played water polo. I was a sprinter  so I love freestyle  but can teach all four strokes with no problem :)

I have been teaching swim lessons at KOPFC for 11 years.  I teach toddlers children teens and adults from beginner through competitive swimmers.  I help youth and adults prepare for triathlons.  I help youth prepare for Lifeguard Training and Junior Guards.  I focus on teaching strong technique  and then building endurance with solid form. I am a mom of four children ages 4-10  and I love what I do.

I have been teaching swimming lessons for over 11 years. I first taught at Kearns rec center and then taught at South Jordan Rec for a short time. I then came back to teach at Kearns. I swam for Copper Hills High school my junior and senior year. I am extremely specific on how i teach strokes to ensure that the individual (child or adult) does it all correctly. I use specific toys to help younger children learn in a fun way and to hopefully distract them from their fear of the water.

I have been teaching swim lessons for 20 years but at KOPFC for three years. I was a diver in high school so I can also teach diving. I love teaching and seeing children learn a new skill in the water. I teach at night because I have full time job as well as taking care of my own children.

Hi my name is Kaden. I been teaching swim lessons for a 18 months. I have been swimming for as long as I can remember and swimming competitively for 2 years. I love teaching all strokes but my favorite stroke is freestyle.
I am in my first year of teaching lessons  and I absolutely love it.

Hello my name is Whitney.  I have been teaching at Kearns for almost 3 years. I love teaching children a life long skill that helps them stay active healthy and safe. I love teaching all ages. I really enjoy teaching children with a fear of water. Watching them go from being afraid to put their face in the water to swimming 50s across the pool in a shirt amount of time makes my heart so happy. Seeing their once fear for water turn into love for the water makes teaching swimming extremely awarding.
Swimming for over 10 years. And have been teaching for 3 years. I coach high school and age group team. Was a collegiate swimmer and swam nationally.
I have been teaching for 1 year. Im good at teaching diving backstroke and butterfly. I work well with children who have special needs.
Ive been swimming for 11 years  I can help with streamline and improving free style

I grew up in this lesson program and have been swimming my entire life. I have been teaching since the beginning of summer this year and I love teaching freestyle and backstroke because those are my favorite strokes to swim.
I think Im very good at teaching freestyle and diving. Im willing to help teach.

I have been a swim instructor for about a year now and will be going on my second this summer. I am very good with kids and simplifying the complexity of the stroke in a way the can comprehend and learn to perform. I am especially good at teaching freestyle  backstroke and breaststroke.

I have been teaching for two years  I coached a youth swim team for one year and I have been a certified life guard for four years. I have taught swimming lessons by both the Red Cross lesson plans and by the lesson plans we have here at Kearns  The Great Aquatic Adventure: Swim It. I swam competitively in high school and I really enjoy helping kids develop a love for swimming as I have.
I have been teaching swim lessons for almost a year  and I have swam competitively for seven years. In the past I have played water polo and I can also teach it as well.
Year 2 swim instructor. 7 years of competitive swim experience. 5 years of water polo experience. Comfortable teaching all age groups

I began teaching in 2005 and absolutely fell in love with it.  I love working with kids and I find it to be very fulfilling.  Im very comfortable teaching all of the strokes and Im willing to look for new ways to teach to help kids figure out which way they learn best.  I really love to work with the tots classes to help them become comfortable and excited about the water.  Its my favorite thing to see a kid who is really scared the first day of class to see the kind of progress they have made and how proud they are of their accomplishments.  To me  thats the best part of this job.

I have been teaching patrons to swim at KOPFC for about 17 years. I have taught babies  toddlers  children  teens  and adults and loved all of them. I have helped patrons prepare to join swim teams  gain speed for meets  or get ready for triathlons but I am partial to  and specialize in  teaching proper swimming technique and general comfort in the water. Swimming is a sport that should be enjoyable and relaxing. I was one of the principal instructors for the adult class for 10 years and LOVED working with adults because of their desire and motivation to learn how to swim. Almost everyone Ive taught has expressed their interest in always learning how to swim but have never been taught the "correct" way to move through the water and have a hard time getting across the pool. I go back to the basics and teach students practical and effective ways to swim that become natural and easy for them to do on their own. I love seeing the confidence and sense of accomplishment when my students get something down because swimming is a life skill and they will have that for the rest of their lives. My hope is that everyone who comes to the facility to learn how to swim  does just that and has an awesome experience while they are here.

I have been teaching for almost two years. I have been swimming for about 4 years. I help my brother coach his swim team. My main strokes are freestyle and backstroke. I do enjoy doing all four main strokes.

This is my first year teaching and I am extremely excited to help kids learn how to swim. I play water polo so for the more experienced classes I can help a lot if your child wants to play polo and I can not wait to start working the children.

I have been teaching for just over a year now. I love teaching kids and seeing how happy they get. My favorite strokes to teach are Backstroke and Breaststroke. I also like teaching turns and dives. Being a swim instructor has been a blast and I love it.
My names Whitney  Im new to teaching but I really love it.
Ive been swimming for 2 years  and have been teaching for a couple months. I enjoy swimming all 4 of the strokes.
I have been teaching swimming for 3 years  after swimming competitively for 10 years  as well as coaching water polo for the past 7 years.
I have been teaching for 2 years now. I like to make friends and have fun. I am on the swim and water polo team.

I have been teaching for 5+ years and have been swimming for 10+ years.  I love teaching new skills to children to help them be safe in the water.  I teach all strokes and other basic water safety skills.

I have been swimming for 6 years  I was on my high school swim team and I made it to state my junior and senior years with freestyle. I am a new swim instructor  so this will be my first year teaching swimming.

I have been swimming since I was 7 years old  I swam on the youth age team at Kearns  along with the high school team. I played water polo for 10 years  9 at Kearns and one in California. I have taught swim lessons at Kearns since 2013  and one summer in Huntington Beach  Ca.

Ive been competitively swimming since I was in fifth grade. Pretty soon after that  I discovered water polo and loved it. Currently Im playing water polo up at the University of Utah. Ive been teaching swim lessons for about six months now. I love teaching specialty strokes like butterfly and breaststroke.

I began teaching last summer but have been swimming competitively since I was 8 years old. I swam the 200 IM and 100 Butterfly in highschool and finsished a respective 4th and 5th in 2015 4A State Championships. I now play water polo and swim for the University of Redlands. I love everything swimming has brought into my life and wish to share the same opportunities with younger generations.
This will be my second summer teaching and Ive been swimming for 8 years. I am good at working with the technique for both freestyle and butterfly.
